## WILLIAM KING MUSEUM OF ART

## NEVER THE SAME MUSEUM

## William King Museum of Art is a dynamic gallery and gathering space in the vibrant arts and cultural community of Abingdon, Va. Exhibits range from contemporary art made right here in Appalachia to fine art from all around the world.

WKMA is also home to the Betsy K. White Cultural Heritage Research Archive. This collection includes some of the most detailed records in existence of our region’s rich decorative arts legacy! Our two cultural heritage galleries reflect this research and celebrate this tradition.

Site Maintenance

The site store (ability to sign up/purchase classes, become a member, and donate online) will be down for planned maintenance between January 3rd-7th. Please call the museum at 276-628-5005 to make a purchase or donation. 

[Weather Related Schedule ChangesFor the must up to date schedule changes, please visit our Facebook page.Click Here](https://www.facebook.com/WilliamKingMuseum)

[FY 2025 Year in ReviewThroughout fiscal year 2025, our skilled and talented staff curated exhibits, provided lectures, and taught art classes to all ages. Adult classes expanded to provide cutting-edge instruction of a wide range of topics in the museum’s Art Lab, and the youth education department continued their delivery directly to schools across the region, as well as continuing our much-loved summer Art Camp.Click Here](https://www.yumpu.com/en/document/read/70860922/wkma-fy-2025-year-in-review)

# Plan Your Visit

Welcome to the William King Museum of Art, where art comes alive and history resonates through every exhibit. Whether you’re a seasoned art enthusiast or exploring the world of art for the first time, our museum offers a rich and immersive experience for all visitors. Nestled in the heart of Abingdon, Va., William King Museum of Art is home to a diverse collection of masterpieces spanning centuries and cultures. As you plan your visit, we invite you to discover our galleries, engage with our exhibits, and participate in our enriching programs designed for all ages. Prepare to be inspired, educated, and captivated by the beauty and power of art.

Museum Hours 

Tues. – Sat.: 10 a.m. – 5 p.m.

Sun.: 1 p.m. – 5 p.m.

Closed on Monday and some major holidays.

Museum Address 

Due to construction the campus can only be accessed through the entrance on Russell Road. The Main Street entrance is currently closed.

**Physical Address:**  
415 Academy Drive  
Abingdon, VA 24210

**Mailing Address:**  
P.O. Box 2256  
Abingdon, VA 24212

Parking 

Free parking for the museum and the Art Lab is available on the west side and front of the museum, as well as the lower west lot. Additional free parking is available in a nearby public parking lot located within easy walking distance.

Accessibility 

During our ongoing construction ADA access parking is in the alley between the museum and Art Lab with the access door into the museum clearly marked at the southwest corner ...
